channel.title: Very anoying!
channel.description:
a few days ago i bought a mp3,but when i got home and tried to turn it on, it didnt work.The next day i went to the store , gave it back and got my money back. Later on that day i went to another store and bought a Sony mp3, but this time the mp3 did work but the program that i had to install on my computer didnt. basically whenever you need to put songs in your mp3 you first need to convert it into Astrac. i used the program SonicStage wich is a fucking stupid program that cant do shit!!! when i want to put something like 10 songs in my mp3 ,5 of the 10 songs wont get in because it couldnt get converted. the next day i want to put more songs into it but then it says i had to delete all songs , so i delete all songs and try to put other songs into it, but as you might've guessed , it didnt work.
from then i did some google searches that said i need to install sp2 or update my windows. Ofcourse installing Sp2 didnt work and neither did the updating i tried reinstalling that shitty Sonicstage over and over again, but it's still the same. I tried updating it, but still the same.
Now im really close into throwing my computer along with my mp3 or walkman(or however you call it) out of the window.
My question is : can anyone help me with this?or does anyone know if there is any other program then Sonicstage?
any help is really apreciated

item.title: Very anoying!

item.description:
@blacker wrote:

[quote=“Flamed_Fury1, post:12, topic:41785”]My sony Mp3 player owns, do does sonicstage![/quote] Take it back and get an ipod, that’s what I did.[br][size=1]Posted on: December 31, 2006, 11:29:25 AM[/size][hr]P.S. Mine was AT&T brand Mp3… wtf???

item.title: Very anoying!
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

lothy:

Hmph, I bet it’s better then that piece of shit Ipod Nano I had… The screen on my Nano is fucked, so I’m sure you’re better off.

http://www.anythingbutipod.com/archives/2006/04/sonicstage-alternatives.php

“Sonicstage Alternatives”

SonicStage is Sony’s Achilles heel when it comes to their line of Network Walkmans. The program is packaged with all new Sony MP3 players and it is necessary to get music onto your player.

Perhaps helpful, I dunno.

Thanks , i’ll try it

If its a Sony, you should be able to access it from Windows Explorer. Just copy you music files to the folder for it(C:, D:, E:, whatever it is) and it should work. Your MP3 player should have WMA and MP3 capability’s, at least, so, I recommend just using Windows Explorer.

Hope this helps!

no, i dont think it supports MP3 or WMA , i did what you said and copied some music on my M: folder but on my mp3 it doesnt play , i says is has an error or something

thanks for your help anyways

If it doesn’t play MP3 or WMA, what does it play?
[/quote]
like i said , it converts everything into Atrac[/quote]

You guys should both go get a Zune. There made by Microshit, but there good. The graphics are like better than a HDTV, and you get radio and 30gb of space and video and music and pictures, and you can set your own background, which I thought was pretty cool.

Read full topic
